intro: Gomphandra luzoniensis, commonly known as the Luzon gomphandra, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as montane forests. It is a shrub or small tree that can reach heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
